text: Just saw a LinkedIn Influencer with 'Organic Growth' written in the profile with 65K+ followers claiming that he can help you in growing your platform, copying the posts from other influencers.

Jobseekers, this one’s for you.
 Every application, every interview, every follow-up… the pressure is immense.
 And I know what you're thinking: Am I not good enough? 
 But let me tell you, this isn’t about you or your skills. It’s about a broken system where 60% of applicants never hear back. 
 Your mental health is not worth sacrificing for a system that doesn’t acknowledge your worth. 
 Please remember, taking care of yourself is the real priority. 
 Your dream job will come, but for now, breathe. 🌻
Looking for jobs on LinkedIn is like online dating: Full of promises, but in the end, you’re just left ghosted.

LinkedIn scams be like: 'Congratulations, you've been selected for a role you didn’t even apply for!' 
 The catch? Pay Rs. 50,000 for the honor.

sapne dekhna achi baat hai,
lekin job ka sapna dekh ke 'interested' likhna,
yeh toh achi baat nahi hai na?

Next time when I'll be reading some LinkedIn Influencer's story, I am starting from the last line.
If there's a link attached to it, it's most probably a fake one.
Saves me time!

Every time I poured my heart into 5-6 rounds of interviews and faced rejection, it felt like a punch in the gut. The sleepless nights, the endless preparation, all for nothing.

But looking back, I realize it wasn’t nothing. It was the Universe’s way of saying, “Not this one, something better is on the way.”

Every single time, I’ve been shown why that rejection happened.

Doors I thought I wanted to walk through were shut, only to have the right ones swing open.

The kind that aligned with my growth, my values, and my happiness.

At first, it stung. It hurt deeply. But now, when things don’t go as planned, I don’t panic.

I don’t question my worth. I sit back, breathe, and trust. The Universe knows.

I know there's another plan waiting. Something bigger, better, and just for me.

To anyone feeling the weight of rejection: trust that the closed doors are protecting you from something you can’t see right now.

Your path is being cleared for something even more beautiful.

To everyone who's still looking for a job...

I see you. I feel you. 💔

Every rejection email feels like a punch in the gut, and every 'We'll get back to you' sounds more like 'You'll never hear from us.'

But I want you to know, you're not alone in this. 🌸

According to a study, 80% of jobseekers struggle with anxiety and self-doubt during their search. It's normal to feel lost, but it's not the end.

Take breaks, breathe, and remember, this doesn't define you. Your worth is not tied to an offer letter. 💥

Your mental health matters more than any job.

Sometimes, we forget that a company’s brand name doesn’t define someone’s talent. It’s easy to get caught up in the 'big company = big talent' mindset, but that's not always the case.

I’ve had the privilege of working with people from smaller companies (lesser known) who blow me away with their skills and dedication. They don’t need a fancy title or a famous brand behind them to prove their worth.

I've seen the other side too—people in top-tier companies feeling lost, overwhelmed, or stuck, even though the world sees them as 'successful'.

Let’s stop attaching someone’s value to the company they work for. Freshers especially need to hear this—skills are what matter, not the size of the company behind them.

At the end of the day, happiness and growth don’t come from a brand name, they come from doing what you love and constantly improving your craft.

So when I left a toxic work environment, I told my manager a simple thing and felt so good 😯

I just said-

'Hope your son gets a manager like you.
I hope that the manager behaves the same way as you did with me.
Thank you.'

Now tell me 1 thing-

She always said that she was a great manager.
Why will she get offended?

I just told her that I wish her son would get a manager like she was.

If you felt bad, then that means you were a bad manager and now you know it. � 80

If you feel good, then take it as a blessing for your son and you'll really want someone to treat your son/daughter in the same way.

She cannot be even angry with me else it'll prove that she was not a 'great' manager.

Muskan - 1
Manager - 0

Muskan -> Aura +100000000

(Fictional message unfortunately :(
)

Hope you all become the people that your sons/daughters will like to work under 🙏

There are a lot of bad people/things, bring a small change and break the chain :)

Hello Connections! 👋

Here’s what I’ve learned from the 𝗚𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗔𝗜 𝗠𝗲𝗴𝗮 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀𝗵𝗼𝗽 𝟮.𝟬 🚀:

Generative AI has truly transformed how we approach creativity and problem-solving! During the workshop, I delved into generative models like GANs, VAEs, and Transformers, which drive applications such as image generation, text-to-image transformation, and language modeling.

One key insight: It’s never been easier to take a problem statement and create an entire startup concept around it! Generative AI provides the tools to ideate, refine, and implement solutions that push the boundaries of creativity and innovation.

🔧 Here’s a breakdown of the tools we used and their incredible capabilities:

1. ChatGPT & Microsoft Copilot: Perfect for generating ideas and refining business opportunities.
2. UserPersona.Dev: Helps craft detailed user personas, keeping your target audience at the core.
3. Namelix & Sologo AI: Instantly create compelling branding and logos.
4. SmasherOfOdds MVP Machine: Build your Minimum Viable Product (MVP) quickly and efficiently.
5. Wegic AI & Clipchamp: Tools for powerful video presentations, making storytelling seamless.
6. FormShare: Simple yet effective for gathering user feedback and refining your product.
7. Gamma AI: Enhances presentations with AI-driven content optimization.

🚀 Takeaways: From healthcare to education and creative industries, Generative AI is revolutionizing multiple sectors. It’s not just about automation—it’s about unleashing creativity, boosting productivity, and making it accessible to everyone. The potential to build solutions for social good and create personalized user experiences is limitless.

This workshop was truly an eye-opener, and I can’t wait to explore these insights further in my future projects. A huge thank you to NxtWave and Tezan Sahu for this incredible learning opportunity!

💡 What excites you the most about Generative AI? Drop your thoughts below! 👇

Hello connections,
 I am excited to share that I have completed my first two AI/ML projects! Here’s a summary of what I worked on:

1. Digit Recognizer using Deep Learning

Project Overview:
In this project, I built a model to recognize handwritten digits from the famous MNIST dataset. The purpose of this project was to understand the basics of image recognition using deep learning techniques.

Steps Involved:

Data Collection: Obtained the MNIST dataset containing images of handwritten digits.
Data Preprocessing: Standardized and normalized the pixel values to ensure better performance.
Data Augmentation: Applied techniques such as rotation and scaling to increase the diversity of the training data.
Splitting the Data: Divided the dataset into training and testing sets for model evaluation.
Training: Used a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) to train the model on the training data.
Hyperparameter Tuning: Optimized the model by tuning parameters such as learning rate, batch size, and the number of epochs.

Through this project, I learned how to preprocess image data, implement a CNN, and apply data augmentation techniques to improve model performance.

2. Titanic Survival Prediction using k-NN

Project Overview:
The goal of this project was to predict the survival of passengers on the Titanic using the k-Nearest Neighbors (k-NN) algorithm. This classification problem helped me understand how different factors influenced survival chances.

Steps Involved:

Data Collection: Obtained the Titanic dataset containing details of passengers such as age, gender, class, etc.
Data Preprocessing: Handled missing values, dropped irrelevant columns, and applied one-hot encoding to categorical variables.
Feature Scaling: Scaled features to ensure the k-NN algorithm performs optimally.
Training: Used the k-NN algorithm to train the model on the preprocessed data.
Hyperparameter Tuning: Utilized GridSearchCV to find the best values for k (number of neighbors) and p (distance metric).

This project helped me grasp the importance of data preprocessing, feature scaling, and the application of k-NN for classification problems.

Key Learnings:
Understanding the importance of data preprocessing and feature engineering.
Implementing and tuning machine learning algorithms for both image recognition and classification tasks.
The significance of hands-on practice in reinforcing theoretical knowledge.

Thanks to NxtWave for providing this wonderful course along with practical projects. The hands-on experience has been invaluable in helping me understand how the code works and apply ML concepts effectively.

Additionally, I have submitted the results of my Digit Recognizer project on Kaggle. Feel free to check it out!

Kaggle Profile: https://lnkd.in/dJXwPi67

Looking forward to more exciting projects and learning opportunities in the field of AI/ML.

Hello connections,

I am glad to share that I have completed my internship at Genik Technologies as a Software Developer.

During my internship, I worked on the development team for Rearticle, a No-code LaTeX typesetting platform. Rearticle is an innovative solution designed to simplify the academic writing process. It allows researchers to effortlessly organize and manage equations, references, tables, and content without needing to learn complex LaTeX code. This platform ensures that research papers are formatted to meet journal standards, saving valuable time and effort, and allowing researchers to focus on the impact of their work rather than the intricacies of formatting.

Working on the Rearticle full-stack website alongside my wonderful teammates and under the guidance of the Genik team has been an enriching experience. 

Throughout the internship, I learned many new techniques in web development that will greatly benefit my career. We used various technologies such as ReactJS, Tailwind CSS, Firebase, Radix UI, and Bitbucket. These tools and concepts have helped me gain valuable experience in both frontend and backend development.

I am grateful to Genik Technologies for this opportunity, which has significantly leveled up my skills and knowledge in web development.

Thank you for all the support, and I look forward to applying these skills in my future endeavors.

Best, 
Naresh B A

Hello everyone! I'm excited to announce that I'm currently diving into the world of Spring Boot at NxtWave, and it has been an incredible journey so far! Thanks to the hands-on experience provided, I've been delving into the intricacies of REST APIs and H2 Database - a Java based database.

For testing purposes, I utilized Postman, which proved to be an invaluable tool for validating the functionality of my API. Special thanks to Rahul Attuluri for his excellent sessions and guidance throughout this learning journey!

HACK-IN-HUB - Where Young Minds Collaborate, Innovate, and Have Fun!🚀🧠🎉

On the 13th and 14th of this month, we turned a distant dream into a reality by hosting a thrilling 28-hour national-level hackathon known as Hack in Hub'23. It was a journey filled with determination, teamwork, and boundless creativity. We extend our heartfelt thanks to Dr. V. Brindha Devi, Head of the Department, and Suthahar P, our staff coordinator, for their invaluable guidance throughout the preparation phase.🙌📅📝

With just 15 days to plan and execute this grand event, we faced a race against time. We meticulously selected over 40 problems for the hackathon, spanning 10 different domains, and ensured every logistical detail was in place. The response was nothing short of extraordinary, with more than 600 registrations pouring in from every corner of the country. The task of shortlisting the top 25 teams was no small feat, as each participant brought their very best to the table.

Our event brought together students from 21 diverse colleges, showcasing a rich tapestry of ideas and talents, highlighting the incredible power of collaboration. I am immensely grateful to my dedicated teammates -Mohamed Ashik Irfan M,Aravindhan Tulsi, Arun Manikandan, SOWRERAJAN N,Jayasuryan N,Priyadharshini A,MOHAMMED FARHAAN N and Others who worked tirelessly day and night to make this event a success. Their unwavering support and creative thinking were the driving force behind our achievement.🙏👏💡

Along the way, we encountered unexpected challenges, but we tackled each hurdle with determination, emerging stronger each time. In the middle of the night, we added a touch of enjoyment to the mix, with activities like dancing💃, music 🎵, and more, bringing everyone closer. We also took the opportunity to engage in thoughtful feedback sessions with the participants, ensuring that their experience was not only innovative but also thoroughly enjoyable.

This event's resounding success was a testament to the hard work and dedication of our entire team. It transcended being just an event; it became a story of teamwork, determination, and the remarkable outcomes of passionate collaboration.🚀💡👏

hashtag#Hackathon hashtag#Innovation hashtag#Teamwork hashtag#HackInHub23 hashtag#Appreciation hashtag#MidnightFun hashtag#FeedbackInterviews hashtag#coding
